items.title: The Honest Woodcutter
items.summary: A story about honesty and its rewards.
items.content: A woodcutter dropped his axe in the river. A fairy appeared with a gold axe. He said 'That is not mine.' She gave him a silver axe. He said 'That is not mine either.' She returned his iron axe and rewarded him for honesty.

items.subject: english
items.title: Twinkle Twinkle Little Star
items.summary: A classic nursery rhyme about stars.
items.content: Twinkle twinkle little star, how I wonder what you are. Up above the world so high, like a diamond in the sky.

items.subject: english
items.title: Nouns
items.content: A noun is a word that names a person, place, thing, or animal. Examples: Ram (person), Chennai (place), book (thing), dog (animal). Proper nouns start with capital letters.

items.subject: english
items.title: Verbs
items.content: A verb is an action word. It tells what someone or something does. Examples: run, jump, eat, sleep, read, write. Every sentence needs a verb.
